Again, NEVER NEVER NEVER measure risk based on price of underlying. ALWAYS ALWAYS measure risk as a % of trading capital.

Yes, I overhauled much of my risk management protocol after 2013. One goal was to bring win rate closer to 50%. I do this not by being right more often but by moving stops to BE or small gain as quickly as possible.
I track trades on a sequential closed trade NAV basis (cume ROR). For my benchmark metrics a 3% DD is at 2 standard deviations.
I never measure risk based on a percent change in the underlying -- NEVER. Risk should always be measured against total nominal trading capital.
